About.Name: Shukra Jaliya Nankabirwa
About.Currently: Software Engineer • ML + XR • Researcher & Mentor
About.AboutText: I’m a software engineer and researcher focused on local-first AI, XR learning experiences, and interactive 3D systems. I build end-to-end tools—from MLX fine-tuned models with RAG pipelines to VR/AR curricula and digital twins—and I teach and mentor students through hands-on, project-based STEM experiences.

Experience.ExperienceText: Below is a summary of my education, work experience, leadership, and technical skills.
Experience.Major: B.S. Computer Science & Engineering • B.A. Honors Liberal Arts • Minor: Data Analytics
Experience.EducationText: Relevant coursework includes Data Structures, Algorithms, Computer Architecture, Systems Design, Database Management, Cyber Security, and Data Analytics.
Experience.Role: AVELA, University of Washington — Seattle, WA
Experience.EmploymentText:
Jun 2025 – Present
• Developed and fine-tuned course-specific language models using Apple’s MLX framework.
• Built BlueComputer, a local-first AI tutor integrating fine-tuning, RAG, and an on/off-topic classifier to keep responses aligned to course content.
• Applied NLP techniques to build and evaluate course-specific language models and response quality.
• Optimized inference and prompt flow to achieve average response times under 8 seconds in a SwiftUI app.

Additional Roles

Extended Reality Technical Lead & Mentor — AVELA, UW (Jun 2024 – Present)
• Initiated the first VR course in the AVELA program, teaching ~30 students to build VR apps and create AR assets.
• Developed a 40-hour XR curriculum; increased student STEM engagement by 25% using a fleet of 30 Quest 3 headsets.
• Built AR workflows using Polycam + WebAR and glTF asset pipelines.

Software Engineer — Sablesync (Nov 2023 – Present)
• Developed full-stack systems for end-to-end 3D room reconstruction and digital twin creation.
• Implemented interactive spatial environments replicating real-world architectural designs with high fidelity.

Technical Mixed Reality Instructor — SPEEA ACE (Dec 2024 – Feb 2025)
• Led hands-on workshops on VR/AR applications for mental wellness and developed a mixed reality mindfulness program.

Undergraduate Research Assistant — UW ECE (Jun 2024 – Sep 2024)
• Conducted research on meta-optics for endoscopes under Professor Karl Bohringer and presented CV/image-processing algorithms.

Reboot Scholar — Reboot Representation (Sep 2023 – Jun 2025)
• Selected for cohort-based professional development, mentorship, and leadership programming.
Experience.Skills:
Programming Languages: C++ (4 years), Python, R, SQL, JavaScript (1 year), Kotlin, Swift
Frameworks & Tools: Apple MLX, SwiftUI, Jetpack Compose, ARCore, ROS, WebAR, Polycam, GitHub, Docker, Jira
Focus Areas: Machine Learning, NLP, Local-first AI systems, XR Development, 3D/Digital Twins
Certificates: Snap Inc. Augmented Reality Extern (Paragon One), Reboot Scholar (Reboot Representation)
Experience.SkillsText: I build end-to-end systems that combine machine learning, human-centered design, and immersive XR tools—shipping reliable experiences with attention to performance, usability, and real-world deployment constraints.

Project1.Title: BlueComputer — Local-First Course-Specific AI Tutor
Project1.Desc: Built a local-first AI tutor that answers only course-relevant questions for K–12 learning activities. Fine-tuned models with Apple’s MLX framework and integrated RAG plus an on/off-topic classifier to keep responses aligned to lessons. Optimized inference and prompt flow to reach sub-8s average response time in a SwiftUI app.

Project2.Title: AVELA XR Curriculum — VR + AR Learning Experiences
Project2.Desc: Designed and delivered a 40-hour XR curriculum to teach students VR app development and AR content creation. Deployed a fleet of 30 Meta Quest 3 headsets and built learning workflows using Polycam + WebAR and glTF asset pipelines to support interactive experiences.

Project3.Title: Digital Twins — Interactive 3D Room Reconstruction
Project3.Desc: Developed full-stack pipelines for 3D room reconstruction and digital twin creation. Translated physical spaces into immersive digital environments by integrating geometry, materials, lighting, and real-time behaviors, prioritizing fidelity and performance.

Project4.Title: HMobile — Robot Control Mobile App (Capstone)
Project4.Desc: Built a mobile UI for a robot control interface using Kotlin and Jetpack Compose. Collaborated with a 12-member team on hardware–software integration, created Git-based documentation, and designed accessible UI theme colors informed by usability research.
